results.title: The Whispering chorus
results.creator_credit: Walker (Lasky) Artcraft and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Dissatisfied with his position in society, John Trimble heeds the dim image of Evil in his mind and embezzles some money; fakes his death and travels the world under an assumed name, becoming an opium addict in Hong Kong. His wife remarries a man who becomes the state governor. He returns home to see his dying mother and is arrested for his own murder under his assumed identity. Knowing that a public revelation of the truth would ruin his wife’s happiness, he listens to the whispering chorus of his conscience and allows himself to be executed. Cast includes Raymond Hatton, Kathlyn Williams, Elliott Dexter.

results.title: The Wheelwright
results.creator_credit: G. Buckland-Smith, Worshipful Company of Wheelwright and David Cons
results.brief_description: Film of one of the few remaining wheelwrights in Britain making a wheel. This is contrasted with the making of wheels for modern motor cars.

results.title: The Wheatlands of East Anglia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Regional Geography”.
The first part of this film deals with the conditions which make East Anglia a good wheat-growing area, and shows both large-scale and small-scale methods of wheat-growing in England, the second part of the film deals with marketing and distribution.

results.title: The What did you think of the movie movie
results.creator_credit: American Film Institute and Jeremy Kagan
results.brief_description: This delightful satire of movie criticism covers the complete range of responses to the question in its title. In the most hilarious scenes, some of the “critics” warm up to their task and get carried away by their reactions to life on the silver screen.

results.title: The Whale savers
results.creator_credit: Levy-Bethune Productions, Neal Bethune, Laurie Levy and Alex Dumas
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the work of conservationists Laurie Levy and Neal Bethune established the Whale Rescue Centre in Melbourne. They argue against the view that whales mass suicide and stress attempts should be made to save them. Includes footage of both successful and unsucessful attempts to rescue stranded whales on the Victorian and Tasmanian coasts. Narrated by Lynda Stoner.

results.title: The Wet fly man's dream
results.creator_credit: Kent Chadwick, Film Victoria and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: Looks at the factors, due to the activities of man, which have depleted the population of several species of native fish in the Murray-Darling river system. Examines some of the work of the Ministry of Conservation’s Fisheries and Wildlife Division aimed at saving these species from extinction. Also attempts to promote native fish species as game fish.

results.title: The Westward movement: an instructional sound film
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows he westward movement in the USA, how pioneers started to immigrate westward. Quite an informative documentary, great for classroom education on the topic.
